channel.title: Hacks on Strange Labs Computers
channel.description: Recent content in Hacks on Strange Labs Computers

item.title: How to think in the world of cyber crime
item.description: Cybrecrime will become more prevailant the more we build technology and networking into our lives. It is pretty scary and rightly so. If you are paranoid, chances are you should be. Here is how I think, and how you should probably think, in this scary technological world. Beware, it is an extreme view not for the feint of heart! It seems over the last few years we are increasingly frequently being informed of this cyber attack, that ransomware infection, this data leak… To me it does make sense that these events would increase.

item.title: Designing a space for technology enthusiasts
item.description: From 2017 to 2020, I had a physical shop, the idea was to convert it from a boring PC repair shop into a social space where programmers could meet to work on projects. This was a post made part way through that development. For the last pics before I closed, go to the end We are half way through a refurbishment in store. So far, the first half has been very successful I would say, both in it’s own aesthetic, and how it reflects the computer enthusiasm nature of the space.

item.title: How to avoid the bait and not get phished!
item.description: One of the most common way to get scammed or hacked is through a method called “Phishing”. It is very easy to fall foul of this type of con and can result in loss of control over your data and identity to the hackers. The following is a guest article by Techwarn which goes some way to help you avoid this sort of attack and educate yourselves in this method of cybercrime.

item.title: Forgotten your Windows 7 password?
item.description: It is every Windows users nightmare: one day you try to log in and every attempt is denied. Whether you have forgotten your password or it has been changed or you need to get in and don’t have the password, there is a way to break in. The Backdoor Take the battery out if you have a laptop and plug in the mains Start windows and then whilst it is starting up, pull the power out to force an automatic startup repair on the next boot.
